sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 1, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen allein; Weg zur Vermittlerin ergebnislos.
Frau Pairamall erklärt, den Brief nicht erhalten zu haben; wird nachtragen.
Bamberger erklärt, Papa wird es zahlen.
Lie-Liechen alone; her trips to the agent inconclusive.
Mrs. Pairamall explains that she did not receive the letter; will remit later.
Bamberger explains that Papa will pay it.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 2, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von der Vermittlerin ein Mädchen geholt.
Frl. Schaab fürchtet, im nächsten Monat das Honorar nicht aufrechthalten zu können, da sie Stundenverlust hat.
Frl. Moscisker kommt um zu danken.
Von Hans Guttmann (Br.): bietet einen Sack Mehl an.
Bamberger behält drei Stunden.
Brünauer meint: wer weiß, was im Januar geschieht!
Von Weisse (K.): = OJ 15/15, [11], December 1, 1921. Partitur abgegeben.
Lektüre Schurig-Mozart Arthur Schurig, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart: sein Leben und sein Werk (Leipzig: Insel Verlag, 1913). gestaltet sich sehr aufreizend.
Fetched a maid from the agent.
Miss Schaab fears that next month she will be unable to keep up payment of the fee, since she has lost pupils who take lessons.
Miss Moscisker comes to thank us.
From Hans Guttmann (letter): offers a sack of flour.
Bamberger retains the three lessons.
Brünauer opines: who knows what will happen in January!
From Weisse (postcard): score handed in.
Schurig's Mozart is developing into very tantalizing reading matter.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 3, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Das Mädchen tritt ein.
Nach Tisch Artaria Rechnung beglichen. Besichtigung der von den Demonstranten verursachten Schäden.
Von der U. E. eingelangt: op. 28, 31 No. 2, 2 No. 1 u. V. Sinfonie; Beethoven V. Sinfonie in: Der Tonwille Heft 5 (1922), 10–42; Eng. transl., vol. I, pp. 182–209. Band II beim 8. Bogen.

In der N. Fr. Presse werden die Seltenheiten "Musikalische Seltenheiten: Wiener Liebhaberdrucke," gen. ed. Otto Erich Deutsch (Vienna: UE, 1921–), in which series the facsimile of Beethoven's "Moonlight" Sonata edited by Schenker appeared as volume I. angekündigt. Berühmte Musikerhandschriften in Faksimile, in: Neue Freie Presse , No. 20569, December 3, 1921, morning edition, p. 10.
The maid joins us.
After lunch settled the Artaria invoice. Inspection of the damage caused by the demonstrators.
From UE: Op. 28, 31, No. 2, 2, No. 1 and "Fifth Symphony" arrived; volume II up to gathering 8.
"Rarities" are announced in the Neue Freie Presse.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 4, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Korrekturen besorgt.
Frau Otti Hey bittet mich sie anzuhoren; muß aber verschieben.
Bei Jetty.
Took care of the proofs.
Mrs. Otti Hey requests that I audition her; must postpone it though.
At Jetty's.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 5, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg:
Im Archiv: Christian Bach, beide Bände Wyzewa u. Mozarts Jugend-Sinfonien gesehen u. darüber Frl. Kahn vergessen, die inzwischen zur
Stunde kommt.
Ersten Band Schurig Arthur Schurig, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart: sein Leben und sein Werk (Leipzig: Insel Verlag, 1913). zuende gelesen, den zweiten durchgeflogen.

In the Archive: examined J. C. Bach, both volumes of Wyzewa and symphonies from Mozart's youth and in so doing forgot Miss Kahn, who in the meantime comes
f or her lesson.
Read first volume of Schurig to the end, raced through the second.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 6, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen meldet die Mädchen bei der Krankenkasse an. 600 Kronen.
An Hans Guttmann (Br.): bitte um Mehl.

Entschließe mich von Schurig erst im 3. Heft zu sprechen. Schenker in fact referred to him in Tonwille Heft 2, 18, 22 (I, p. 65, 69), and Heft 3, "Vermischtes", 29, 31, 32 (I, pp. 125, 171, 172), where he speaks of Schurig with contempt.
Von Sophie (K.): erkundigt sich nach unserer Lage, ist sehr besorgt.
An Sophie (Br.): über die Lage.
Im Archiv Schurig zurückgestellt.
Besuch im Sanatorium: Frl. Elias geht morgen nachhause.
Zu Mozio: 10000 Kronen zurück.
Lie-Liechen registers the maids with the health insurance. 600 Kronen.
To Hans Guttmann (letter): I ask for flour.
Decide to speak about Schurig only in the third issue.
From Sophie (postcard): inquires about our situation, is very concerned.
To Sophie (letter): about the situation.
To the Archive Schurig returned.
Visit at the Sanatorium: Miss Elias is going home tomorrow.
To Mozio's: return 10,000 Kronen.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 8, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Vom jungen Rosenblatt (Br.): er müsse erst die Ankunft der Mama abwarten.
Arbeit an Mozart Mozart Sonate A-Moll (Köchel-Verzeichnis Nr. 310), in: Der Tonwille Heft 2 (1921), 7–24; Eng. transl., I, pp. 55–71. fortgesetzt.
From young Rosenblatt (letter): he will have to await the arrival of his Mama.
Continued the work on the "Mozart."

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 9, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Bei denkbar schlechtestem Wetter Vorräte bei der Rohö eingekauft; – 18000 Kronen.
In the worst conceivable weather purchased supplies at the Rohö; – 18,000 Kronen.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 10, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Auf die Karten zu den Furtwängler-Konzerten 1200 Kronen nachgezahlt.
Abends im Café Aspang; – 150 Kronen.
Paid 1,200 Kronen extra for the tickets to the Furtwängler concerts.
In the evening in the Café Aspang; – 150 Kronen.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 11, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Arbeit; Lie-Liechen schreibt.
Work; Lie-Liechen writes.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 12, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Das Mädchen entfernt sich u. kommt den ganzen Tag nicht heim.
Glässner dichtet die Fenster im Arbeitszimmer: 1400 Kronen.
Von Hammer Brief. = OJ 11/36, [4], December 9, 1921.
Abends kommt Gisi mit einer Freundin u. erklärt gehn zu wollen! Sofortige Auszahlung: 900 Kronen.
Duchent: "Tuchent": Austrian for "Bettdecke" (duvet, blanket). 11910 Kronen (in eine Steppdecke verwandelt.)
The maid departs and does not come home all day.
Glässner seals the windows in the study: 1,400 Kronen.
From Hammer letter.
In the evening Gisi comes with a girlfriend and declares that she wants to leave! Immediate settlement: 900 Kronen.
Duvet: 11,910 Kronen (converted to a quilt.)

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 13, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Mozart Mozart Sonate A-Moll (Köchel-Verzeichnis Nr. 310), in: Der Tonwille Heft 2 (1921), 7–24; Eng. transl., I, pp. 55–71. fertiggestellt; Korrekturen.
Von U. E. Fahnen zu II2.
"Mozart" completed; proofs.
From UE galley proofs for Counterpoint 2.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 14, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Frl. Schaab erzählt vom Verlauf des gestrigen Abends.
Mittagessen bei Lembacher: 870 Kronen; im Caféhaus.
Nach der Jause mit Lie-Liechen zur U. E.: urgire das 2. Heft.
Lose: 320 Kronen.
An Landesmann (K.): erinnere noch einmal.
Miss Schaab tells us about the order of events from yesterday evening.
Lunch at Lembacher's: 870 Kronen; in the coffee-house.
After teatime with Lie-Liechen to UE: urge them to publish the second issue.
Lottery ticket: 320 Kronen.
To Landesmann (postcard): reminding him once again.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 15, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen kocht zuhause, Anni hilft aus.
Um 12h Weisse: zeigt einen Brief von Floriz, worin Vortrag über Schenker erbeten.

Nach der Jause 2. Heft Tonwille abgegeben bei U. E.: Gründe für Aneinanderreihen der Mozart u. Beethoven-Sonate. i.e. that the Mozart article should precede the Beethoven: Mozart Sonate A-Moll (Köchel-Verzeichnis Nr. 310), in: Der Tonwille Heft 2 (1921), 7–24; Eng. transl., I, pp. 55–71; Beethoven: Sonata opus 2 Nr. 1 ibid, 25–48; I, pp. 72–95.

An Frl. Elias (K.):
Wünsche für baldige Genesung.
Fahnen gefeilt.
Lie-Liechen cooks at home, Anni helps out.
At 12 noon Weisse: shows me a letter from Floriz, in which a lecture about Schenker is requested.
After teatime handed in the second issue of Tonwille at UE: reasons for the succession of the Mozart and Beethoven Sonata.

To Miss Elias (postcard):
wishes for a speedy recovery.
Polished up the galley proofs.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 16, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Sophie (Br.): besorgt, bittet um Nachricht; über Julians Stellungswechsel, die Ablehnung eines Postens seitens Frieda.
Schaab zahlt die 2. Rate.
Mittagessen bei Turetzky: 896 Kronen.
Fahnen zur U. E. gebracht.
Brünauer spricht von Lasten –; Angst vor Erhöhung.
From Sophie (letter): is concerned, aks for news; about Julian's change of employment, and about a post being turned down on the part of Frieda.
Schaab pays the second installment.
Lunch at Turetzky's: 896 Kronen.
Brought galley proofs to the UE.
Brünauer speaks about encumbrances –; fears of an increase in fees.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 17, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Marie Schodl tritt ein: macht besten Eindruck.
Mozart Epilog gefeilt.
Von U. E.: Klisches zu op. 2 No. 1; Vertrag u. zwei Exemplare Tonwille.
Von Frl. Elias (express): werde Montag kommen.
Lie-Liechen bringt den Epilog ins Reine.
Marie Schodl joins us: makes a very good impression.
I fine tune the Mozart epilogue.
From UE: engraved examples to Op. 2, No. 1; contract and two copies of the Tonwille.
From Miss Elias (express): will come Monday.
Lie-Liechen makes a fair copy of the epilogue.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 18, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Letzte Ausfertigung.
Zu Jetty; überbringen ½ kg Café, 1 kg Hirse u. 14 Hemden zum Ausbessern.
Last copy.
To Jetty's; bearing a ½ kilo of coffee, 1 kilo of millet and 14 shirts to be mended.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 19, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Ich lobe Frl. Kahns gebesserten Ton, worauf sie erwidert: „So sehen Sie, sie haben mir Unrecht getan, ich studiere halt so.“.
Lie-Liechen schließt gegen Abend ab.

Hupka erscheint gegen 7h; seine Erlebnisse in München, Frankfurt, Berlin; Vrieslander habe den Saal bei den Brahms-Variationen Brahms, Variations and Fugue on a Theme by G. F. Handel, Op. 24 . verlassen, aber gebeten, mir davon nichts zu sagen! Busoni habe sich als persönlich beleidigt hingestellt, schließlich aber einen Gruß an seinen Freund Schenker zu bestellen gebeten.
Hupka schildert eine köstliche Theorie-Stunde bei Busoni.

An Hammer (Br.): = JOB 94-3, [1] = OJ 5/15a, [1] = OC 1B/46-48. über grundlegende Unterschiede zwischen Malerei u. Musik, denen zufolge die Urlinie offenbar etwas anderes ist in beiden Künsten bedeutet.
I praise Miss Kahn's improved tone, to which she rejoins: "So you see, you have done me an injustice, I do study thus."
Towards evening Lie-Liechen finishes.

Hupka appears at around 7:00; his experiences in Munich, Frankfurt, and Berlin; Vrieslander left the concert hall during the Brahms' Variations, but pleaded with him to say nothing to me about it! Busoni behaved as if he was personally insulted, finally though requested that greetings be sent to his friend Schenker.
Hupka depicted a delectable theory lesson with Busoni.
To Hammer (letter): about fundamental differences between painting and music, as a result of which the Urlinie evidently is means something different in both art forms.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 20, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von U. E. (Br.): = OC 52/296, December 16, 1921. stimmt zu, beide Analysen ins zweite u. die Beethoven-Literatur ins 3. Heft zu drucken. If this refers to the "Literatur" section of the Op. 2 No. 1 article, then it was printed in Tonwille Heft 2, 43–48 (I, pp. 88–95).
Brünauer bringt ein Exemplar der Mondschein-Sonate; mir selbst wurde noch keins zugeschickt.
From UE (letter): agrees to print both analyses in the second issue, and the Beethoven "Secondary Literature" section in the third issue.
Brünauer brings a copy of the "Moonlight" Sonata; none had yet been sent to me personally.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 21, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Manuscript selbst zur U. E. gebracht.

An Dahms (Br.):
über den Inhalt des 2. Heftes, namentlich über Mozart.
Großes Räumen im Hause.
Mittags ein Neffe von Landesmann, der den Luster gebrauchsfertig macht.
Von Frl. Elias (Br.): dankt für die Vorbereitung am Montag.
Heini borgt sich 10000 Kronen aus.
Brought the manuscript to UE myself.

To Dahms (letter):
about the content of the second issue, namely about Mozart.
Grand re-arranging of the apartment.
At midday a nephew of Landesmann, who puts the chandelier into workable order.
From Miss Elias (letter): thanks for the preparation on Monday.
Heini borrows 10,000 Kronen from us.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 22, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Frl. Elias zur ersten Stunde.
Lie-Liechen backt Kuchen; kauft 5 Dosen condensierte Milch: 4800 Kronen.
Miss Elias for her first lesson.
Lie-Liechen bakes a cake; buys five cans of condensed milk: 4,800 Kronen.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 23, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Deutsch (K.): ersuche, das Honorar an die deutsche Bank zu leiten.
An die deutsche Bank, Frankfurter Zeitung u. Tägl. Rundschau wegen des Quartalwechsels.

Brünauer sehr aufgeregt, bringt Bonbons; Lie-Liechen entdeckt im Vorbeigehn ungefähr 300000 Kronen in seiner Rocktasche u. stellt ihn wegen solchen Leichtsinns zur Rede; in seiner gewohnten Art sagt er, es sei nicht viel u. – gehöre nicht ihm!
To Deutsch (postcard): request that he divert the fee to the Deutsche Bank.
To the Deutsche Bank, Frankfurter Zeitung and Tägliche Rundschau because of the change of quarter year.

Brünauer very agitated, brings candies; while passing by Lie-Liechen discovers approximately 300,000 Kronen in his coat pocket and demands an explanation from him about such recklessness; in his usual manner he says that it's not that much and – it doesn't belong to him!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 24, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Hupka erhöht sich selbst auf 4000 Kronen mit den Worten: wir müssen das regulieren, – worauf ich erwidere, daß ich mir ohnehin nicht die Stunden bezahlen lasse, nur die Regie des Hauses; er nimmt das Cdur-Conzert von Mozart Confirmed by lessonbook 1921/22: "Apart from the concert program, Mozart Piano Concerto in C major". in Angriff u. leistet aus Eigenem das Schlechteste.
Frl. Elias mit Bonbons; zahlt im Nachhinein für Dezember 24000 Kronen, ich kündige die Erhöhung an.
Noch spät abends werden Vorhänge aufgemacht.
Marie erhält 3000 Kronen u. verschiedenes Obst, sie reicht uns die Hand.

Of his own volition Hupka increases his fee to 4,000 Kronen, with the words: we'll have to adjust it, – to which I retort that, anyhow, I am not taking payment for the lessons themselves, only for the running of the home; he then sets about the C-major Piano Concerto by Mozart and of his own accord accomplishes the worst.
Miss Elias with candies; pays retrospectively 24,000 Kronen for December, I announce the increase.
Quite late in the evening the curtains are opened.
Marie receives 3,000 Kronen and various fruits, she shakes our hands.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 25, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Nachmittag zu Jetty; sie Oberst zugegen, Fülle im Haus, Freude.

Abends: erstes Diktat zum Vermischten. Vermischtes ; because of controversy with UE, this was deferred from Der Tonwille Heft 2 (1921) to Heft 3 (1922), 26–38; Eng. transl., vol. I, pp. 121–37 (see pp. vii–viii for an account of the controversy.)
In the afternoon to Jetty's; they the Colonel is present, a full house, joy.
In the evening: the first dictation to "Miscellanea."

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 26, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von U. E. (K.): = OC 52/297, December 23, 1921. bestätigen den Empfang der beiden Analysen.
Abends Diktat Hölderlin.
From UE (postcard): they confirm receipt of both analyses.
In the evening dicate Hölderlin.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 27, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Hans Guttmann (Br.): trägt mir 100000 Kronen an.
Von Frida (K.): Weihnachtsgrüße.

Nach Tisch mit Lie-Liechen Spazier-
gang in die Stadt, Buchauslagen besehen.
From Hans Guttmann (letter): offers me 100,000 Kronen.
From Frida (postcard): Christmas greetings.

After lunch a walk with Lie-Liechen strolling
in the Inner City, have a look at bookshop windows.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 28, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Am Vermischten. Vermischtes ; because of controversy with UE, this was deferred from Der Tonwille Heft 2 (1921) to Heft 3 (1922), 26–38; Eng. transl., vol. I, pp. 121–37 (see pp. vii–viii for an account of the controversy.)
Working on "Miscellanea."

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 29, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Deutsch (K.): = OJ 10/3, [26], December 28, 1921. habe mir 1200 M. angewiesen.
From Deutsch (postcard): has authorized payment to me of 1,200 Marks.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 30, 1921

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Orlay (Rechnung: 3600 Kronen.
Ein Briquett: 312 Kronen!
Weisse überbringt den Vorschlag eines Schülers, Szalay, der auf Schutz des Geldes gegen Entwertung hinzielt.
Zur U. E. Fahnen gebracht u. Hupka an zwei Klavieren angehört.
Bamberger u. Brünauer für Januar Erhöhung angekündigt.
From Orlay ( Invoice: 3,600 Kronen.
One briquette: 312 Kronen!
Weisse conveys the suggestion of a pupil, Szalay, which is aimed towards protecting one's money from devaluation.
Brought galley proofs to UE and heard Hupka on two pianos.
Informed Bamberger and Brünauer about an increase in fee for January.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker December 31, 1921

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Dr. Oppel (K.): = OJ 13/10, [9], December 29, 1921. Neujahrsgruß.
Schlosser Mitrenger verlangt 1000 Kronen u. meint, heute koste eine halbe Stunde 4000 Kronen.
Nachmittag zu Jetty; 30000 Kronen entliehen um sie Weisse übergeben zu können.
From Dr. Oppel (postcard): New Year's greeting.
Locksmith Mitrenger desires 1,000 Kronen and opines that these days half an hour's work costs 4,000 Kronen.
In the afternoon to Jetty's; borrowed 30,000 Kronen to be able to hand them over to Weisse.
